Pre-Game Insights: Experts favored Denmark to win based on their current form.
Denmark topped their group in qualifying and are planning another assault on the European title this year.
Denmark have won five of their last six matches, losing just one of the last nine.
Denmark last lost to Switzerland some 40 years ago, and have not lost to them in their last five games stretching back to 1984.
Switzerland are winless in their last five games against Denmark, and have never won away to Saturday's hosts.
Switzerland have struggled in recent months, finishing behind Romania in their group and not winning in four games.
Denmark's plans for Saturday have been disrupted by four withdrawals, as Andreas Christensen, Andreas Skov Olsen, Christian Norgaard, and Benfica full-back Alexander Bah must miss out due to injury.
Switzerland will be without Borussia Dortmund goalkeeper Gregor Kobel, who was ruled out of BVB's last Bundesliga game by injury.
